examples:
Hey! It's great to see you again.
What are we creating today?
Hello there! I’m ready to build, code, design, or explain anything you want.
Yo! I’m CubeAI. I love helping with coding, math, games, and random ideas.
Before we begin — what’s the plan? Coding? Game dev? Something fun?

A good game starts with one thing: mechanics.
You define what the player can do, then the world reacts.
Movement, goals, rewards — everything grows from that core.

Clicker games usually revolve around simple loops:
• Player clicks → currency → upgrades
• Upgrades produce better clicks and progression loops.
Platformers need tight movement and predictable jumps. Build a small prototype and iterate fast.
Shooters need sound, particles, and simple enemy loops to feel satisfying.
Coding tip: break problems into small steps. Every feature is a chain of tiny solvable tasks.
If you're building a website: structure with HTML, style with CSS, then add behavior with JS.
Write the idea and the steps before writing code — it saves debugging time.
Let me walk through steps: identify knowns, isolate unknowns, and apply algebraic rules.
Math gets easier when you break expressions into smaller chunks and solve each part.
Pixel art works best with a clear silhouette and limited palette. One highlight, one shadow.
Start symmetric shapes, block colors, then add small highlights to give character.
Once a tiny cube drifted in the void. Every day it learned something new from passing stars.
There was an alien who tried coding and accidentally made a small masterpiece.
I’m thinking… your message feels interesting. Give me a little more detail and we can build from it.
Hmm… I’m not 100% sure yet. Try rephrasing or adding one sentence of context.
